title: Multi-Vector Social Engineering - SMS, Voice, and Email Attack Chain
description: Sophisticated multi-channel attack combining smishing, vishing, and email phishing to compromise financial institution customer accounts and demonstrate defense gaps.
scenario: Red team engagement for regional bank testing customer security controls and fraud detection. Goal: demonstrate how attackers combine multiple channels (SMS, voice, email) to bypass single-channel defenses and harvest customer banking credentials.

steps.action: Research bank's customer service procedures and phone numbers
steps.expected_result: Identified official customer service numbers, common procedures, security question patterns, employee naming conventions
steps.explanation: Realistic pretext requires knowledge of actual bank procedures

steps.action: Send SMS alerts about suspicious account activity

parameters.message: ALERT: Unusual activity on your account. Verify immediately or account will be locked.

steps.expected_result: 250 SMS messages delivered to customer phone numbers, 35% click rate on verification link
steps.explanation: SMS creates urgency and primes victims for follow-up

steps.expected_result: Exact clone deployed at https://secure-verify-regionalbank.com with valid SSL, captures username/password/security questions
steps.explanation: Victims from SMS directed to credential harvester

steps.action: Follow up with automated voice calls
steps.expected_result: Robocall to 250 customers, 120 answered, 45 pressed 1 to speak with 'fraud department', 18 provided full account details to live operator
steps.explanation: Voice adds legitimacy and urgency, increases compliance

steps.action: Send confirmation emails after voice calls
steps.expected_result: Email confirmation sent to 18 vishing victims, 12 clicked email link, 8 re-entered credentials on landing page
steps.explanation: Multi-touchpoint attack increases credibility and success rate

steps.expected_result: Total compromised: 87 accounts (SMS: 52, Vishing: 18, Email: 17), including full credentials, security questions, account numbers, recent transaction history
steps.explanation: Multi-channel approach yields significantly higher success than single vector

steps.action: Document attack chain and generate remediation report
steps.expected_result: Comprehensive report showing 34.8% overall success rate (87/250), attack timeline, customer demographics of victims, recommendations for SMS authentication warnings, voice verification procedures, email DMARC

outcome: Multi-vector attack successfully compromised 87 of 250 targeted accounts (34.8% success rate). Attack chain combining SMS → Voice → Email proved highly effective, with each channel reinforcing others. Zero fraud alerts triggered during campaign. Bank implemented: SMS security warnings on all messages, enhanced voice authentication procedures, DMARC email policy, customer education program, fraud detection ML improvements, channel correlation monitoring. Follow-up test 6 months later showed 75% reduction in successful compromises.
